data.Title: Perplexity Launches Revenue Sharing Program Amid Plagiarism Concerns
data.Description: Perplexity is launching a program to share ad revenue with publishing partners following weeks of plagiarism accusations. When Perplexity features content from these publishers in response to user queries, the publishers will receive a share of the ad revenue.

data.Title: Google Advises Against Switching M-Dot URLs to Canonical
data.Description: Google's John Mueller reiterated that websites should not switch their m-dot URLs to be the canonical URL, even though Google has fully transitioned to mobile-first indexing. He explained that this is because of how the system is currently set up and changing it on Google's end could cause issues for many large websites.

data.Title: Google Search Console Performance Report Filter Bug to Be Fixed
data.Description: Google Search Console has a bug in the Search Performance report where filtering by Search Appearance doesn't show all the options. Google is aware of the bug and it should be fixed soon.

data.Title: Google's Antitrust Defense May Benefit from SearchGPT Threat
data.Description: The emergence of generative AI, particularly OpenAI's SearchGPT, poses a new challenge to Google's dominance in search. This new competition could play a role in the outcome of the ongoing antitrust trial against Google, potentially bolstering the company's defense.

data.Title: Google Tests Link Icon Citations for AI Overviews
data.Description: Google is experimenting with displaying link icon citations for AI-generated overviews in search results. This move aims to provide users with more transparency and context about the sources used to generate these summaries.

data.Title: OpenAI Announces SearchGPT Prototype
data.Description: OpenAI has unveiled a prototype of SearchGPT, its own AI-powered search engine. This announcement has intensified the competition in the search market, putting pressure on Google to innovate and improve its search product.

data.Title: Ahrefs Launches Content Changes Feature
data.Description: Ahrefs has introduced a new feature called Content Changes, allowing users to track content updates and modifications made by their competitors. This tool aims to provide insights into how content changes impact search rankings and visibility.

data.Title: Apple Maps Appears in Google Search Results
data.Description: Apple Maps listings have been spotted appearing in Google SERPs, indicating a potential shift in the local search landscape. This development has sparked discussions among SEO professionals about the implications for local SEO strategies.

data.Title: Microsoft Tests Bing Generative Search Experience
data.Description: Microsoft is rolling out a generative AI-powered search experience for Bing to a limited number of users. This new feature aims to deliver more dynamic and comprehensive search results by leveraging the capabilities of generative AI.

data.Title: Reddit Blocks Bing Search, Limiting Access to Recent Posts
data.Description: Reddit has taken measures to block AI bots from major search engines, including Bing, unless they reach an agreement. This move aims to prevent these bots from scraping and utilizing Reddit's content without permission.
